section.name: LoggerAppenderMongoDB
section.p: LoggerAppenderMongoDB appends log events to a mongoDB instance.
MongoDB is a scalable, high-performance, open source, document-oriented database.

subsection.name: Layout
subsection.p: This appender does not require a layout.

tr.td: Server on which mongodb instance is located.
Port on which the instance is bound.
Name of the database to which to log.
Name of the target collection within the given database.
Username used to connect to the database.
Password used to connect to the database.
For how long the driver should try to connect to the database (in milliseconds).

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: This example shows how to configure LoggerAppenderMongoDB to log to a remote database.

div.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderMongoDB"> <param name="host" value="mongodb://example.com" /> <param name="username" value="logger" /> <param name="password" value="secret" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
